intro: Camissonia walkeri var. tortilis, commonly known as the twisted camissonia, is a flowering plant native to California. It is a member of the Polemoniaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, blue-violet flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats, often in open areas with full sun exposure. Its leaves are narrow and often twisted, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is a perennial herb that thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native region.
